inn1.comm: good zippy length on off stump, solidly blocked
a slight turn of the wrists, but straight enough not to be eased through the leg-side
good ball, this one nips off the seam and strikes the thigh pad. Lively start
rising outside off, jabbed out to point with a bit of a hop
a touch wider and that one really climbs through. Jayawardene lifts his gloves high above his head to avoid a touch
attacking the ribs and that's fended into the leg-side for a single. Good start from Jimmy
good ball on a string, bending in late to strike the middle of the bat on off stump
a touch of swing but too much width, slapped heartily past point who should have done better, but Broad at third man sprints round to save the boundary with a tumble
outside off, left well alone
outside off again, but that ball crept a touch. Through to the keeper on second bounce
that's the area, climbing towards off, and defended urgently back down the pitch
smoothly driven to cover, an easy single, and a solid start from England's bowlers
slightly leg-sided delivery, tucked off the hip for a single
a bit of an inside-edge as Dilshan plays a fraction down the wrong line. A squirted single to fine leg
outside off once again, and blocked with a full face of the bat to cover
pushed onto the back foot, defended into the off side
good probing work from Anderson, full and straight, threatening to nip either way. Defended cautiously
slightly shorter, zipping back into Jayawardene's defensive prod
driven on the up, and that pierces the cover ring. The first boundary of the day, and very well struck
aggression from Dilshan, who swings through the line of a full-length delivery, doesn't quite time it
too much width, but he gets away with it as Dilshan slaps a short ball straight to Trott at point
better length, driven hard back to the bowler
too short, and that's walloped, hard and flat through midwicket. No margin for error on this track, clearly
sharp work from Trott at point once again - he's very close to the bat, and is in business
tucked around the corner to backward square
forced back onto the stumps by a back-of-a-length delivery. Sharp pace
Tip and run from Dilshan, and that's going to be out! Crazy run, straight to Broad at mid-on, who steadies himself and under-arms a diving shy onto the non-striker's stumps
tight line and length, defended back down the track
angling into the stumps, turned to short square
pushed on the up to point, and another less-than-convincing run. The shy goes wide this time, but it would probably have been safe
solidly blocked, back down the wicket

dropped by Swann at first slip! It was less an edge, more a glide over the slips, and to be fair, it was a tough fingertipped chance. Kieswetter could have caught the rebound if he'd known where it was going
off the mark with a single straightaway
flicked off the pads to square leg
edged, and just short of Swann, who is being assaulted at both extremities. That one died a foot in front of the fielder, and hopped away for four for good measure
Bresnan is seriously hacked off now. Two chances, and yet a good over goes for 12. A firm drive through the covers
flicked off the toes, down to fine leg
misdirected, onto the toes again, and that's well played. Whipped square, beats the diving fine leg as he sprints round
slower ball from Anderson and that's driven in the air, just short of cover. It's all happening!
tucked off the toes again
forward, and blocked down the wicket
forward and defended to short cover. Good over
a touch of width, and chopped down to third man
poked out to point from a good length off-stump delivery
tip-and-run again, and a bit of hesitation almost proves fatal! The shy goes wide from point as Chandimal makes his ground
dabbed down to third man, good strike rotation
open faced drive, and well struck. Threaded through the off-side field for another boundary
back of a length, defended with a hop
lively! Short and rising steeply, and that takes the splice but bobbles away safe
turned to midwicket to keep the strike rotating
tight on off stump, defended to cover
full length, blocked firmly back down the track
a shovelled drive from a full length, not quite timed and short cover tidies up
a touch of width, and that's exquisite. Just guided wide of third man, who made a good gallop, but never got close

ridiculous! That is an absolute carbon-copy of the Dilshan dismissal! Only this time, Anderson is the fielder off Broad's bowling, rather than the other way round, and Billy Bowden didn't need the benefit of a replay to give it. Tucked to mid-on, a crazy call, a good pick-up, a diving shy
floated onto the pads, but tucked straight to midwicket
short, and flicked round the corner to fine leg
edged, and inches short! A smart take at slip by Swann, but Sangakkara avoids a first-ball duck.
full face this time, and pushed back down the track
blocked again, sturdy stuff. That's the end of the first Powerplay
goes full, and with a hint of angle into the batsman, who nudges defence into the leg side
again Anderson finds a good line and length and cover comes buzzing in to field
the extra bounce here doesn't bother Jayawardene, who rocks back to chop down to third man
Sangakkara flicks a single off his hip down to fine leg
full length from the bowler, full face from the batsman. England's ring of cover fielders are full of life today
solid defence to end the over
Broad has started quite full today, which is uplifting news for England fans. His reward is sturdy defence from Sangakkara
blocked solidly to point
back of a length this time but the line is impeccable
this time it's full but again Broad isn't letting his line go awry. Prodded to midwicket
this time Sangakkara manages to clip wide of midwicket, without great timing but enough to switch the strike
Jayawardene flicks his hands over the ball at the top of its bounce sending it down to fine leg. Lovely stuff
rare misfield at third man leaves Anderson in full tea-pot mode. Fired Dernbach a filthy look, it only cost a run though as a late cut headed down to the fielder
straighter line from the bowler leaves Jayawardene no space to manoeuvre a single
excellent line and length from the bowler. The World Cup Anderson seems a long time ago
Anderson maintaining line and length on a dreamy pitch for batting. Absolutely not seam movement for him
clipped around the corner this time for a single
left-hander instead of right but the line and length remain perfect. Solidly blocked to point
starts straight, which befits England's progress this innings, Jayawardene blocks
slipped through quicker from the bowler but at the cost of some width. Jayawardene barley seemed to feather this cut but it shot to the point boundary
big appeal from the bowler, largely to celebrate finding the pads. It was heading down. Dernbach doesn't seem the type shy of an appeal
slower one this time and the batsman is well aware of it
probing around off stump at a decent pace. Jayawardene solid in defence
much slower from the bowler. 85mph to  68mph in two deliveries. The line remains good, as does Jayawardene's defence
starts his new spell full around off stump, a rare piece of poor timing from Jayawardene means Broad can field off his own bowling
short this time and pulled sweetly to fine leg. Good shot for one that, he'll feel he's missed out
flicked off the toes wide of deep square for a couple
back of a length this time and worked to midwicket
driven hard, but straight to cover
misfield at midwicket allows Sangakkara to pick off a single with a leg-side flick
Jade digs this in shorter and Sangakkara seems to be wait to pull to deep midwicket
anything near Jayawardene's pads and he's happy, flicking this easily to fine leg. Somehow he's ghosted up to 44
slipped too far down leg
driven to mid-off, and rather than run suicidally, Sangakkara waits, sees the pick up from the fielder, and calls no. Sensible
good lines from Dernbach, forcing careful defence
another slower ball, Sangakkara seemed very aware of it and popped it into the leg side
another real slow one but again the batsman seems to read it. Jayawardene waited in position to dab and eventually the ball arrived and glided off the face to third man
sharp, full delivery from Broad, seems to burst through an attempted drive and Kieswetter couldn't collect it cleanly
shorter length this time and Sangakkara rocks back to  clip to midwicket
collective 'aaah' from everyone that saw this. The Sanga cover drive is always a treat. Broad went and wide, offering the invitation that Sangakkara was happy to take up
this time it's guided backwards of point for a single
picked off the pads to midwicket by Jayawardene. He could do that blindfolded
steered again by Sangakkara but this time he picks out point
first ball after the refreshments is nibbled off the hip for a single to square leg
shorter ball is steered down to third man easily. England should be a bit concerned, these two masterful batsmen are  well set on a very generous batting track
very steady defence. England's ability to take middle-overs wickets on batting-friendly tracks has always been a problem
clipped to deep midwicket with a minimum of fuss
another single with another wristy flick
fifty for Jayawardene, classy one too. Gets there with an elegant late cut and looks set to make plenty more
some peculiarly sloppy fielding turns this couple into four, all-run four as nobody backs up the throw from deep midwicket
careful defence this time from outside off stump
delicate, late, late dab can't quite beat short third man
the batsman walks across his stumps to flick a single to leg
Swann round the wicket and defended calmly
slightly fuller length means Sangakkara can drive through cover
touch of extra bounce finds the shoulder of the bat but it loops over where slips would have been to third man
solid, sturdy defence. He's going nowhere fast
Broad's pouncing dive at fine leg can't stop this going for four. The ball deserved it to be fair. Short and wheeled pull shot races towards the rope
beaten outside off. Jayawardene seems to misread a slower ball and drives at fresh air
another slower ball and again Jayawardene mistimes his shot, poking to point
airy drive heads out to third man on the bounce
poked to third man
this time the gap is found wide of third man
this rags, really turns and jumps outside off stump. Sangakkara was rightly alarmed but played it well
this is a touch short and allows the batsman to rock back and drive
some spin from a shorter length has Sangakkara defending off the back foot
driven wide of cover to bring up the fifty stand
a boundary! But it's off the edge of Sangakkara's bat. He's been a bit edgy on off stump today ...
fuller and straighter from Dernbach, Sangakkara tucks him neatly into the leg side to bring up Sri Lanka's hundred
Dernbach lobs down a slower ball well wide of off stump, Jayawardene crashes it square but there's a man out on the boundary
another slower one, this one dipped and turned like a legcutter but Sangakkara spotted it early enough to pick up a single to fine leg
Dernbach sends one down gun-barrel straight outside off and for some reason Jaywardene can't lay bat on it. Just played inside the line
this one hits the seam and jags back in towards the pads, Jayawardene shapes to glance but can't get it away
looped down on middle and off, Jaywardene nudges to square leg for a single
Swann comes round the wicket to Sangakkara, who stretches forward to defend
this one is slightly slower through the air, and nicely straight again. More defence from Sangakkara
Kumar is setting himself for a long innings here, nudging quietly to leg this time
Swann offers a hint of width and Sangakkara takes the chance for a single, placing the ball into a gap at cover
pushed down to long-on for a single
he starts with a loosener that is low on pace but is nicely accurate, and Jayawardene defends to Morgan at point
guided down to third man
Sangakkara nudges off the hip for a single
a hint of width offered once again, and Jaywardene collects a single to third man
a slower ball from Broad, but it's a fairly innocuous one and Sangakkara swivels into a paddle-pull that sends the ball racing to the fine leg boundary
tighter line and length this time, Sangakkara defends
eased down to long-on for a single, these two keeping the score ticking along very nicely now
this could've been runs, Swann comes round the wicket and spears a ball at leg stump, but Sanga's glance finds the man at short fine leg
we've come to expect better from you Jimmy! Sangakkara taps to Anderson in the covers, and a fumble allows a single
Swann twirls one down on middle and off, Jayawardene defends

short and wide outside off, Jaywardene cuts but the cover sweeper sprints round to stop the boundary ... oh, and we almost have a collision between the batsmen as they come back for the second, but Mahela side-steps at the last moment
tapped back to the bowler to end the over
jammed down on a splice-jarring length. Sangakkara tries to nudge to leg but the ball goes nowhere
fuller this time, but on the pads once again and this time it's flicked to long leg
very full outside off, Jayawardene responds with a flashing cover drive that had a somewhat Caribbean flavour to it, his weight remaining on the back foot
chopped down to gully for a quick single
very nearly the yorker from Broad, but Jayawardene's eye is in and he digs it out into the leg side for a single
smashed wide of that mid-on fielder! Sangakkara walked down at the bowler and cracked the ball in the air down the ground. It was hit at a catchable height, but wide of any fielder
nudged down the ground for a single
the arm ball from Swann, holding it's line into the left-hander's pads. Sangakkara whips to midwicket
offspinner this time, and Sangakkara offers watchful defence
ooh, very nearly beaten in the flight! Sangakkara came down the pitch but Swann saw him coming, pulling the length back. Sanga had the ball covered with bat and pad though
a touch short, Sangakkara picks up the length early and pulls in the air out to deep midwicket
turned to leg with the spin
chipped in the air, but over the infield! It was pitched up by Broad - though not nearly the half-volley - and Jayawardene gets the bottom hand into the stroke to lift the ball over the fielders
full and straight, from over the wicket, and Sangakkara nudges to mid-on
again Broad targets the pads, this time Sangakkara looks to whip the ball much squarer but can't get it away
frustration for the batsman. Broad served up a juicy half-volley and Sangakkara leaned into a crisp cover drive, but the shot went straight to Anderson in the ring
Sangakkara works with the angle to get a length ball down to third man
another yorker from Broad, Jayawardene digs it out on the off side this time
chipped once again by Jayawardene, Bresnan sprints round from midwicket to cut off the boundary
nudged much more cautiously to leg this time
Sangakkara hops out his crease and drives down to long on
this was really slow through the air from Swann, flighted wonderfully, but Jayawardene got right to the pitch and helped himself to a single through square leg
again Sangakkara uses his feet, but Swann sees him coming. Some turn and bounce there, and Sangakkara had some work to do to keep that out
gosh, these two are using the chip shot to great effect here. Sangakkara lifts the ball cleanly down the ground, no danger in the shot, he knew exactly what he was doing
decent start, Jaywardene has a cautious look first up
nudged away for a single
KP comes round the wicket to Sangakkara, but sends this one well down the leg side. Kieswetter whips the bails off but the back foot was grounded the whole time
solid defence into the covers
chipped yet again, this time the ball goes out to deep midwicket
width outside off, Jayawardene cuts and though he doesn't get the boundary he does bring up the 100 partnership
short this time, and Jayawardene is completely at ease pulling out into the vacant spaces on the leg side
tip-and-run into the off side, and they shoot through for a single
Jayawardene attempts to turn the ball into the leg side with the spin, but he clips it straight to the midwicket fielder
glanced down to fine leg for one

a little too short from Swann, Sangakkara hops back and pulls into the air out to deep midwicket, there's the 150. The second and third fifties of the innings having come from 56 deliveries each, fluent stuff
flicked out to wide long on, and they amble through for one
Sangakkara hangs back and punches out to long-off
fired down the leg side and Sangakkara helps it along its way to the fine leg boundary to bring up his half-century
this is slipped down the leg side again but Sangakkara can't fiddle it past a fielder
pushed firmly to midwicket
this time he beats the infield, clipping it fine of square leg
dabbed into the midwicket region
Sangakkara skips down the wicket, picks a gap wide of midwicket and flicks a couple into the region. Nicely done
Swann dives nicely to field off his own bowling
knocked around the corner but to fine leg
too much width from Swann allows Jayawardene to rock back and cut late down to third man
Sangakkara happy to be very careful in defence
neatly done, chipped down the ground one-bounce to long-off running in
Swann is lucky here, he fired down the leg side but Jayawardene's glance picked out short fine leg. Either side of the fielder and it would have been four
starts with a gentle leg-side delivery that Sangakkara very happily works around the corner
play and a miss outside off stump! Jayawardene trying to fiddle to third man but was beaten
ah so good from Jayawardene, wait late on a late dab and gliding so fine that a diving Broad running from third man had no chance
short ball is pulled, with a lot of timing, to the leg side
nibbled into space without a modicum of effort
Jayawardene takes himself to 99 with a late cut, and keeps the strike too

that is a masterful, classy hundred for Jayawardene. So coolly done. Gets there by chipping a single down the ground and earns warm applause. Pumps his fist to the dressing room and he's got plenty of time to get a lot more
Bresnan hurries Sangakkara a touch here with a full ball
these two are making life look so easy, here Sangakkara edges down the wicket and eases a couple through the off side
really good shot that would have had four but for an equally good save  by Trott at long-on. Sangakkara advanced down the track and drove perfectly straight with wonderful timing
beaten! Oddly. Outside off stump, just a touch of  extra pace
Sangakkara looking to advance clips a single to pinch the strike
Anderson continues but doesn't look particularly devilish here, allowing Sangakkara to glance a full ball off his toes
shorter length this time but the line is such that Sangakkara can tuck off his hip
good ball this time, jumping from a length and Jayawardene alarmed in defence. Well, not alarmed maybe but surprised at least
Jayawardene waits leg side of the ball and opens the face to glide to third man
broad-batted defence outside off stump. Interesting that Anderson could be bowling out his overs now, England perhaps don't fancy him in the death overs any more after the World Cup
excellent work from Sangakkara, hopping down the wicket and flicking powerfully to deep midwicket
Jayawardene advances so Bresnan digs it in short, in response the batsman slashes a cut to deep point
top work from Jayawardene. Really good stuff. With mid-off up , he clears his front leg, leans back and clumps this over the infield for four. These two motoring now and Cook under pressure
with the latest of dabs Jayawardene glides a single
nudged with soft hands into the on side
poor delivery with fine leg up. Slower ball dragged short and down the leg side. Jayawardene swivels to help it over the infielder and run away to the boundary
better delivery to finish the over. Hitting the pitch back of a length around off stump
starts with a trademark slow one, Sangakkara waits on it and prods a quick single to  the leg side
quicker delivery but it's wide of off. Jayawardene slashed at it, missed, but it was a wide anyway
another quicker ball but enough width for Jayawardene to chop fine, with a hint of top edge, for four

back to the slower ball which is worked to leg and for some reason it's all kicked off. Dernbach having a rant at Jayawardene, who is none too impressed and has a chat with the umpire. Cook then gets involved. All because the pair almost collided when the single was taken
worked away for a single
slower ball is defended back to the bowler who then picks up and glares. Not sure Dernbach is nearly senior enough to be trying this sort of chat
carefully defended back to Swann

gone this time! Swann strikes and it's wonderful bowling. Tossed up, bit of drift, beating Sangakkara in the flight as he advanced before spinning past the edge to allow Kieswetter to whip the bails off
starts with a very careful defence outside off stump
whipped away with a flick of the wrists, through Anderson, much to the disgust of Swann
this time Jayawardene is careful in defence
worked leg side to end an excellent over
the battle continues but Dernbach is short and wide and Jayawardene dips it away for a single
bit of a grim delivery this, dragged short and down the leg side, luckily for the bowler Mathews' pull only got a single
dropped by Cook at cover! Dernbach almost had his man! Jayawardene drives uppishly, Cook jumps full-stretch to his right but couldn't cling on
more secure this time working to third man
left alone outside off stump
wide shoved down the leg side
good ball to finish the over. Quicker, short of a length but bang on off stump. Mathews rises with it to defend
great take from Kieswetter down the leg side saves this from being five wides. It was speared full and at the pads down the leg side. Brushed the leg but the umpire didn't see it
slower ball bouncer this time and it's swung away to deep square
Mathews clips a full ball off his toes to midwicket
Broad gets this wrong, high full toss. Jayawardene leans back and glides it pretty much off his chest over the short third man for four. Such good batting
another full toss, he's not comfortable aiming full. Jayawardene flicks to deep square
oh dear, despite the field set Broad hammers down a short ball. Mathews backs away and helps himself to the boundary over the short third man
good grief, Broad has lost his radar here. This is shoved down the leg side again and but for Kieswetter's desperate glove, would have been four more
the yorker is overegged into a full toss, but better that than short. With a whip of his wrists Jayawardene  sends this down to deep square. Good start to the Powerplay for the visitors.
great stop by Bresnan at short third man! That was four if it passed him, Jayawardene cutting well
Dernbach aims for the yorker this time, following the batsman, who had backed to leg. He can't stop the single though
Mahela slaps a high full toss almost straight to Cook at cover, but they'd committed themselves to a single
another full toss, this one low and dipping, is punched down to long on
Jayawardene punctures the off side field with a flamboyant drive! The weight stayed on the back foot and the hands scythed through the line, great shot
good comeback from Dernbach, who fires in a pinpoint yorker. They steal a single all the same
not a great start from him, looping an inswinger well down the leg side
that's better, a yorker on leg stump is dug out to cover
bah, he's lost it again! Another delivery speared down the leg side

Mathews backs to leg and this time Anderson does the right thing by following him, the yorker pinging him on the boot ... and Jayawardene had backed up pretty far as Anderson collected the ball, but the bowler chose not to have a shy at the stumps. Not sure why, had he hit Jayawardene was well out
with fine leg up, again Mathews backs to leg and again Anderson follows him. This time they sneak a leg bye
Jayawardene attempts the paddle-scoop, but succeeds only in edging the ball onto his own pad
great placement! Something of a heave from Mathews, but he picked the gap between midwicket and wide long-on perfectly
Anderson's radar has gone completely here, another one goes down leg
decent finish to what was, at times, a slightly shabby over, as a very full delivery is dug out for a single
Mathews had set himself for a paddle to leg, but seeing the ball wide of off switched his stance to chop the ball down wide of gully
now it's Jayawardene targeting the fine leg boundary, he mis-times the shot completely but the ball loops short of the man at short fine
good strike, Mathews making room and thrashing the ball through the ring of men in the covers
four more! This time Mathews goes straight down the ground, getting real power in the shot but keeping the ball on the ground. Fifty partnership up, from 32 balls
slower one from Dernbach, but this one goes awry and is called wide as it shoots wide of off
back-of-the-hand and slow again, this one on target and pushed down the ground
Jayawardene backs away and slashes wildly, beaten outside off by a full-pace delivery
and there's another boundary! Bresnan is welcomed back by a meaty drive which beats cover and races away
Bresnan gets the yorker just about right, and Mathews digs it out to leg
another great yorker, but this one has cost him four runs! Jayawardene backs away to leg and Bresnan follows him, the ball kisses the toe-end of the bat and beats a diving Kieswetter
Jayawardene attempts to shovel the ball over short fine leg, but misses completely
another superb yorker, the ball shooting off the inside edge and going to short fine leg
Mathews slaps a low full toss out to deep midwicket, and some tag-team fielding by Bell and Anderson keeps them to two

gone! Swann removes Jayawardene with an arm ball that rushes straight on, the batsman running past it to be easily stumped by Kieswetter. What a fantastic knock it was from him, he set a new personal best of 144 and has guided his team into a great position after they had been looking decidedly wobbly
offspinner, nudged back to the bowler
there's a big appeal as Kulasekara is struck on the pad, but it's well outside off
swiped into the leg side, and they're back for the second
much quicker through the air, practically a medium-pace delivery, and Mathews eases it down the ground
tossed up a little slower, and driven down to long-on
a bouncer from Bresnan has Kulasekara ducking and diving after he had given himself some room, backing to leg
another bouncer, Kulasekara swings wildly and a top edge flies high over Kieswetter's head ... but a fantastic sliding stop by Broad saves the boundary
just short of a good length and angled at leg stump, Kulasekara swivels into a pull to get the fine leg and put Mathews back on strike
full and straight, nudged to midwicket for a single
Kulasekara steps right across to off stump and attempts to mow the ball over the midwicket boundary ... but doesn't get a good connection at all, the ball dropping well short of the fielder
great yorker to end the over, right on target and there's not much Mathews can do with it
slower bouncer to start, Kulasekara is through the shot before the ball even arrives
and now the quicker bouncer! Kulasekara bent his knees and flapped at it, but the ball buzzed past his grille in a flash
swiped out to deep midwicket, some good fielding on the boundary saves a couple of runs

dropped by Swann, who had just been brought up to short fine leg! Kulasekara was targeting the boundary down there, and hit the ball hard just to Swann's right ... he got a hand to it, but couldn't hold on. He chases after it, but his foot is in contact with the boundary as he hauls the ball in, so that's four
full and straight, Kulasekara slams the ball back at Broad, who gets a boot to it

full again, Mathews swings across the line to send the ball out to midwicket, and they push hard for a tight second run ... well, it should have been tight, but the throw back at the stumps wasn't great. "Pretty ordinary," says Holding on commentary, and he's right
Kulasekara clears the left leg and swings hard, but can only get a single to long-on
Mathews finds the boundary! A superb little flick from him, the bottom hand comes into the shot and he twists the wrists at the last moment to place a full-toss to wide long-on
fired at the toes, the ball beats the bat and they take a leg bye
bouncer from Bresnan, Kulasekara seemed to have been expecting it as he was right across on the off side, but he couldn't lay bat on it
well, the short ball had been troubling Kulasekara and now it's dismissed him: a top-edged pull loops out to Pietersen, running in from the midwicket boundary, and Sri Lanka lose their fifth wicket
Bresnan gets the yorker right on target, and Mathews can't find the single to get back on strike for the final over
Broad digs in a bouncer, which Jeevan Mendis was ready and waiting for, but he just tried to hit it a little too hard, and the bottom edge goes nowhere
not quite so short this time, but still short enough for Mendis to pull out to deep midwicket
a high full toss is slapped out to Cook at deep cover
slower-ball bouncer from Broad, again Mendis was waiting on the back foot and creamed it over deep square leg. There's the 300

Broad charges towards his team-mates with his finger in the air, his back turned to the umpire, as Mendis is struck on the pad, swiping across the line ... but Billy hasn't given it out, and they steal a leg bye
big finish from Mathews, who steps to leg and sends a drive scorching through the covers for four

inn2.comm: solid start from Cook, leaning into a cover drive that goes all along the ground to deep cover
good from Dilshan, aiming around off stump. Kieswetter blocks
bit of spin and Kieswetter was very hesitant in defence
this slides down the leg side
sturdy push down the ground for a single
Cook tickles around the corner to change the strike
Kieswetter clips neatly off his toes to deep midwicket to end a quiet, but interesting, opening over
easy for Kieswetter, full and begging for a drive, Kieswetter leans into a punched off-drive and it races across the quick outfield
better length this time and Kieswetter is happy to flag it through
Kulasekara is happy to venture full in search of swing, but there is none about. Kieswetter picks out short midwicket
good line hugging off stump. Kieswetter quietly defends
more solid defence from the batsman as Kulasekara finds a good length and line again
this is again quietly let through from Kieswetter. So England not overdoing it with the big-hitting early on
Cook reaches around his front pad to prod to leg
this was not perfectly timed at all, thickish inside edge really but it does the trick for Cook. Couple of steps down the track and lofting a drive over mid-on
the fielder heads back and Cook works a single wide of midwicket
Kieswetter gets all of this! First six of the game as Kieswetter shimmies down and crashes a drive into the stands over long-on
after the power comes the grace, dinking a late cut to third man
flatter and quicker ball almost squeezes through but Cook jabs a bat down in time
Kieswetter happy to go on the walk at Kulasekara but only to defend
good stuff from Kieswetter, bristling with intent. Again he's down the track, gets a length ball and some width, which is more than enough for him to swing his big arms through the line at
Sangakkara is up to the stumps in response so the batsman this time glides down to third man
Cook is more controlled, as is his way. Gets a good ball too, heading for the top of off before he defends
sliced drive at a length ball outside off goes backward of point for a couple
another on-the-up drive was half-stopped at cover but still allowed Cook to get through for a single to keep the strike
very orthodox start from Malinga, on a length just outside off, Cook drives to cover
back of a length this time but the line is tighter. Cook blocks back to the bowler
good pace, good line, good length and nowhere for Cook to go
touch slower here, but Cook reads it. The line is so tight that Cook can't manoeuvre a run
finally Malinga strays a touch wide and Cook climbs into a cut shot. Mullered it to the rope
for the second time Malinga loses his line, this time heading down the leg side
Malinga recovers his radar and Cook reverts to defence
huge appeal as Kulasekara finds the pads on off stump. Big inside edge though, so loud I thought it had bowled Kieswetter
good delivery this, just decked away off the track. Kieswetter was trying to glide it away but was beaten
good length and line again and Kieswetter, with Sangakkara up to the stumps, is respectful in defence
shorter length from Kulasekara allows the batsman to rock back and punch a drive to deepish mid-on
Cook nudges a single away, as anonymous and effective as that shot is in Tests
good delivery from Kulasekara blocked down the pitch
Malinga is full of pace but Cook easily tucks a couple off his hip
pushed with a very straight blade down to mid-on
excellent stuff from Malinga hitting a solid line and length
slower ball is clipped economically into the leg side
Cook tries to shovel this into the leg side but can't find a gap
quick single ensures Cook keeps the strike. Decent start from England's openers here
good line is rewarded with careful defence
Kulasekara finds an edge with lands just short of gully. Bursts through the hands on the half-volley
fuller delivery whipped off the pads but straight to mid-on
again Kieswetter finds mid-on with a well-timed clip
mid-on set deeper for this delivery so Kieswetter's clip in that direction earns a single
Cook forces an off-stump delivery wide of mid-on for a single. Timed it well
extra pace from Malinga that Cook pushes to Jayawardene at short cover. The fielder fluffs the take - allowing a single -  and hurts his finger in the process
Kieswetter has played this shot a few times today, angling it to third man
whipped off the hip, Cook enjoying the pace on the ball
bouncer doesn't get up all that high and Kieswetter jerks out the way, slightly melodramatically
bouncer followed by yorker which Kieswetter defends
speared full and down the leg side, must have flicked a shoe-lace or something. Maybe a toe end of the bat, either way, it wasn't wide
flash and a miss outside off stump
and again, Cook probably trying to hit it too hard. Has an enormous yowee at fresh air
this time Cook does connect but picks out short cover
back of a length from the bowler, Cook solidly clips to midwicket and finally gets down the other end
touch of invention from Kieswetter, getting down low to Dil-scoop to fine leg. Lot of work for two runs, mind
slower ball from Kulasekara, good one too. Ends a sound Powerplay for England, both sides still in the game after 10, which is a relief because one-sided ODIs are rather tedious
Cook is just trying to overdo it at the moment, here he leans back and tries to murder a cut shot. Ends up edging down to third man
gone! Kieswetter can't believe it but Sri Lanka are thrilled! Short ball was pulled hard and flat but straight to fine leg who came in nicely and took a low catch
swing for Lakmal, first swing of the day I reckon. Trott blocks it out but it was a good first delivery to get
excellent delivery, angling back heading for the stumps. Trott defends quietly
Trott does what he likes best, nudging a single to midwicket
sharp fielding, with added tumble, from Randiv at point saves runs off Cook's firmly-struck cut
Kulasekara finds a good length and Trott pats to cover
slower ball is nurdled to leg
with a flick of the wrists, Cook whips to square leg
very sharp fielding at cover means Trott's drive is fruitless
bouncer dug in, Trott ducks under it. He's always happy to take his time
again Trott picks out a fielder, this time at midwicket
Cook clips a single off his thigh
Trott gets a ball close enough to his pads for him to work to leg
Lakmal aims fuller but ends up serving up a leg-stump half-volley that Cook glances to deep midwicket
don't bowl short to Cook. It only ends up one way. He was in position very early and clattered a boundary to straight midwicket
Lakmal is full, and all the better for it, Cook works to mid-on
good delivery to end the over. Back of a length around off stump
Trott is certainly taking his time. Mistiming a drive to  mid-off
good fielding at point saves runs as Trott tries to give himself room outside leg stump to drive
good work from the bowler, angling it back into Trott, finding an inside edge that trickles to midwicket
how strong is Trott? No boundaries, will he resist doing something silly? Here he backs away to drive but toe-ends to the bowler
this time he gets it away, but only for a single off this pads
all the dots force Cook to do something different and Cook sticks one in the eye of his doubters by crouching low and Dil-scooping over his head for four!
good delivery from Lakmal, searching full and straight. Trott blocks down the ground
again it's a good ball from Lakmal that Trott can do nothing with
single picked off the pads
Cook tries to force a drive down the ground from a length ball, can't really time it but hares through for a single
bouncer that Trott ducks under, he then practices a pull shot
Lakmal almost ruins a good over with a leg-stump full toss but smart fielding on the boundary saves him
nudged gently to cover
too short from the offspinner, and Cook cuts but a touch of extra bounce takes the timing out of the shot, resulting in an ambled single
attempted reverse-paddle from Trott, but he doesn't get anywhere near it
chopped away through gully for a single
held back nicely by Randiv, the ball gripping and bouncing - and also turning a little
full and straight, Cook leans forward to drive through mid-on for a single
nice start from Lakmal after the break, landing one on a great length on off stump. Cook stands at the crease and punches to mid-on

great effort to get to the ball, but Mathews ends up giving away four runs! Cook had chipped the ball towards midwicket, and perhaps hit it slightly harder than he was hoping ... Mathews came charging in and leapt forward, but the ball dipped under his fingers and rolled over the rope
flicked to leg, easy single
half-hearted appeal from Lakmal as an offcutter catches Trott high on the left pad, definitely going down leg
Lakmal is keeping the ball nice and full here, but Trott steps forward and clips to wide long-on
pitched up yet again, Cook taps the ball back to the bowler
Trott waits deep in his crease and angles his bat at the last moment, picking up a single to short third man
clipped off the toes out to deep square, Cook called for the second run but they had to push to get back in time
looped up temptingly by Randiv, Cook waits in his crease and drives to the man at backward point

gone! Cook skips out of his crease and aims an inside-out drive over extra cover, but only gets as far as Mathews, jogging in from the cover boundary. He was scoring quite freely, but the steadily rising required rate has tempted him into an injudiciously aggressive shot
tapped down behind point for a quick single
Pietersen lunges out to smother the spin and defend to cover
Lakmal hits the channel on off stump, Trott defends
chipped high over the bowler's head ... he doesn't quite hit it well enough for a maiden six in ODIs, but there's enough on it to beat mid-on, running back
ah, he's missed out here. Lakmal was straining for a yorker but over-pitched and dished up an inviting full toss outside off, just the single as it's driven out to cover
nice and full, Pietersen steps to the pitch and drives to get off the mark
possibly the attempted bouncer from Lakmal, but Trott isn't rushed and slaps the ball out well in front of square on the leg side
full on off stump, Pietersen squeezes the ball to point
looped up outside off, Pietersen walks into a bottom-handed drive to send the ball to long-on
flighted wonderfully again by Randiv, and midwicket backs up his good bowling by charging round to stop the single
tapped gently into the covers
quicker one from Randiv, Trott bends into a reverse-sweep but picks out the man at short third man
very full, Trott steps forward to take the ball on the full and ease it down to long-on
turn for Randiv! Pietersen had come forward to defend, but the ball ripped past his inside edge and hit him high on the left leg
tossed up on middle to start, driven down to long-off
did I say part-time? This was a quality delivery from Mendis, who gets the ball to grip and spin and take the leading edge. Falling safely though
sliding a little too far towards leg stump, and Pietersen clips to midwicket
whipped through square leg for a single
turn and appreciable bounce for Mendis. KP treats the delivery with respect, defending back to the bowler
looped down the leg side, Pietersen misses the sweep but must have got something on it as it's not called wide
turn and bounce, the ball is glanced to fine leg
Pietersen dances out of his crease and nudges to wide mid-on for a single
so many runs coming through mid-on, another single bunted down the ground

six for Pietersen, but this must've had the fielder interested for a while. The ball pinged off the slog sweep, but it just seemed to hang in the air as it flew towards midwicket ... ultimately enough on it
quicker, and also possibly the arm ball. Pietersen defends
flicked to leg for a single to end the over
tossed up by Mendis, KP comes down the track to turn it into a full toss and drives down the ground
Trott's bottom hand sends the ball out to wide long-on
definite note of aggression in Pietersen's sweep, but there's a man out at deep square to stop it
flighted up very high and very slow indeed, Trott slams the full toss out to deep cover
Mendis is bowling these really slowly, this one is defended back to him by Pietersen

brilliant catch! Pietersen came down the track and lifted the ball towards wide long-on, Malinga sprinted to his right and dived, sliding along the turf but managing to keep both hands on the ball. That wicket will really lift Sri Lanka, Pietersen was starting to look really dangerous
lobbed up on middle and off, Trott turns the ball to midwicket
a touch too short, punched out through point for a single
full on off stump, tapped back to the bowler
this one went straight on with the arm, taking the inside edge and ricocheting off the pad
glanced off the pad out to deep midwicket
well, Trott misses the reverse-sweep, but Sangakkara misses the ball, and that'll be four ... well, the umpire has signalled runs there, so perhaps he got a very thin touch on it
great shot! Just the fourth ball he's faced, and Morgan has absolutely nailed a reverse sweep behind square
and he follows that up with watchful defence as the bowler adjusts his length
a slightly risky shot, Morgan cutting off off stump, but he's picked up a single
a hint of spin for Mendis, but it's far too wide and easily cut away
full and straight, driven hard back to the bowler
wrong 'un this time, but it's too short and Morgan has time to rock back and pull through midwicket
a flighted offspinner beats Morgan's bat as he bends into an orthodox sweep, but that's pitched well outside leg
too short, and Morgan picks the gap between midwicket and long-on perfectly after hopping back to pull
nudged to square leg
flighted outside off, Trott leans forward to defend
and again. Trott hints that he was trying to get this one to short third man, but he chopped down on the ball and it went to Sangakkara, on the bounce
turned with the spin out to midwicket
full outside off to start, and Trott drives through extra cover
Malinga aims for the yorker but doesn't quite get it right, and Morgan drives a long half-volley down to long-off
again Malinga targets the base of the stumps, but it's not in the blockhole and Trott clips out in front of square on the leg side
nippy bouncer from Malinga, Morgan just about managed to keep his eye on the ball and pull through midwicket
superb timing from Trott, who just leans over a leg glance and bisects the field in the deep. Quality.
a high, reverse-swinging full toss takes Trott somewhat by surprise, and he taps it back to the bowler
whipped off the pads through square leg
fetched from well outside off into the leg side, plenty of bottom hand
a full toss is cracked out to deep cover
chopped down behind square on the off side, the point fielder sprints and dives but can't get a hand to it
bouncer from Lakmal, but Trott is under it with time to spare ... and in fact that's called wide. Too short

forget Malinga, Lakmal steams to the crease and fires in an absolutely perfect inswinging yorker at high pace! Trott was in, but there's nothing he could do about this, he jammed the bat down but the ball was already through him. Great follow-up after the bouncer from the previous delivery
very full again, dug out into the leg side
bouncer from Malinga, Morgan steps back and paddles the pull down to fine leg
full and straight this time, jabbed to leg
a hint of reverse swing for Malinga, but Bell defends solidly to leg
pushed to the left of mid-on, and as the fielder runs round they sprint through
slower ball from Malinga, but Morgan was ready and waiting for it and slammed the ball to the midwicket boundary
Malinga follows that up with an attempted yorker that ends up a low, dipping full toss, and Morgan drives to cover
this one hits the pitch and moves back in, Bell stays back and defends to leg
Bell walks across to off and glances neatly down to fine leg. The confident shot of a man in form
now Lakmal tries the slower ball, but Morgan is in no trouble as he chips in the air to midwicket. He's picking both the seamer' variations
short and rising on off stump, Morgan hops into an uppercut and Jayawardene has to sprint across from third man to stop the boundary
full and straight, eased down to long on. I must say, Lakmal does have a fantastic mullet. I wonder if he'll set a trend and spark a revival?
another slower offcutter, this time Morgan doesn't capitalise, pushing it back to the bowler
very straight from Randiv, who doesn't have an action that suggests ripping spin. Bell defends
excellent line again from Randiv outside off and Bell can't get it away
this delivery is pushed down to long-on but the required rate is climbing
dragged down short but Morgan can't take full toll, cutting to the sweeper on the off-side boundary
again Bell milks, but only for a single
thumped firmly back at the bowler who parries the chance, guess you could call it a drop but it really was struck hard
swept hard around the corner
Bell picks off a reverse-paddle which third man fields smartly
Morgan thrusts a foot down the ground and swings his arms through a big heaved sweep, just clearing deep midwicket
now that's six, 12 almost! Short ball that Morgan mauled flat into the stands over midwicket
fired down the leg side, too far
after that flurry Morgan is quiet in defence
quick feet tried to set up a cut shot but Morgan could only toe-end to the bowler
Dilshan is back into the attack and trying Bell down here in defence
slightly too short and Bell gets deep into his crease to milk another single to long-on
dragged down again but Morgan's cut finds deep cover
Bell gives himself room to squeeze a cut shot away but can't really get much power on the shot
some extra spin made Morgan play this squarer than he hoped, but it went one bounce to the sweeper on the off side
Bell attempts to dab a single to third man without much success
chopped to deep point
driven down the ground
again he's picked off into space
Morgan stands tall to punch a single to long-on
for no good reason Bell plays and misses outside off. He's oddly uncertain here after being so sublime in the Tests
more conviction on the cut shot here to deepish point
the ball has just been changed and Bell marks the occasion by chopping behind square for one
this is clipped off the pads into the leg side
Morgan loves pulling the spinners but doesn't time this too well, toe-ending to midwicket
Bell stands tall and pinches to mid-on. Picking out the fielder again
this is swept hard and wide of short fine leg
nothing here for Bell, who needs to get a move on
a fuller length invites Morgan to drive firmly out to deep cover
this is not what he'd want - full facing a drive straight to the bowler
better from Bell, turning his wrists over it a touch to send it wide of the bowler and pick up a single
fifty for Morgan, but if England are going to win this they'll need fifty more from him. Gets there by dinking a single to leg, he's played so well, as usual
finally Bell gets his run-to-third-man shot right, piercing the infield and it needed a swift chase and sliding stop from Malinga to save the boundary
Morgan never fails to find at least a single it seems, here earning one with a drive
Randiv is driven quietly down the ground
Bell on the reverse-sweep this time, and landing it well, placing it fine and again it needed a sliding effort to save the boundary

Randiv strikes and that could seal the match! Another player out stumped but Morgan could have got back. It was a top delivery, turning and bouncing past Morgan's attempted drive as he leapt down the track, Sangakkara almost fluffed the take as it reared up towards his neck, Morgan had given up though and Sangakkara had time to steady the take and take off the bails
Bresnan is the new man and starts with a very sturdy defence
Randiv slides this down the leg side
play and a miss as Randiv finds some extra bounce to beat Bresnan's cut shot
forced around the corner to ensure Bresnan keeps the strike
Bresnan pushes into the off side
more calm defence from Bresnan, what's he cooking?
Mendis is rushing through the over and Bresnan, try as he might, can't get it away
again Mendis hurries Bresnan and fields smartly off his own bowling
that rate is climbing and Bresnan keeps finding the field
finally Bresnan beats the bowler, but the single means he keeps the strike
Randiv is doing an excellent job, extra bounce, Bresnan tries to work it away but can't
very frustrating for Bresnan as he tries to work a single but can't
well that was coming! Bresnan tries to break the shackles with an almighty swipe, top-edges and it flies out to deep midwicket who holds a good catch on the boundary edge
ah England and ODI spin, always the same. Bell pokes to midwicket
this time Bell manages to work a single but England need plenty more than that
Broad flicks a single off his toes to long-on
googly from Mendis, fair to say Broad didn't read it. He groped helplessly and misses
this is all ending quickly! Another googly that Broad stretches, gropes at, misses, overbalances and ends up stumped. Top bowling and it ends a pretty unhappy game for Broad
shortish ball is forced down the ground
Bell very respectful in forward defence
England need 10 an over but Bell has a plan, involving forward defence
another quiet forward prod to end the over. Not sure what they're up to here
slower ball to start, Swann angles his bat to get the ball down to third man
flashing square drive from Bell, a great shot but he's hit it straight to the fielder
the bouncer draws howls of approval from Sangakkara as Bell looks to uppercut but can't get a touch on it
this is great limited-overs bowling, now Malinga sends down a slower ball wide of off that beats Bell's flailing bat
another slower ball, and all that Bell can do is tap it back to the bowler
chipped just over mid-off, who was sprinting back, and they come back for the second
slower cutter to start, Swann taps to cover and the fielder fires in a shy ... but there's no-one backing up, so that's an overthrow
nudged to leg, they scurry through for a single
Bell skips down the track and cuts over backward point for a welcome boundary! Can he give England a chance?
another great shot, Bell coming down the track and getting down on one knee to drive, but he smacks it straight at the fielder
a low full toss tails into the batsman's toes, and is clipped out to deep square leg
Swann walks out at Kulasekara, looking for a big shot, and the bowler responds with a bouncer that is low on pace but is very well-directed, buzzing past his grille
Malinga zips a wide yorker under Bell's bat as the batsman backs to leg to give himself room
is there anyone better than Malinga at the death of the innings? This time it's a slower ball that loops past the outside edge
a much-needed boundary! This time Bell picks the slower ball, hanging back and angling his bat to send the ball to the fine leg boundary
slung far too wide of off, and rightly called by the umpire
slower ball this time, it's tapped down the ground for a single
short and rising up at Swann, who leans back and hammers a pull over midwicket! He didn't exactly keep his eye on the ball, but hit it well enough. England are still alive here
a very canny slower ball to finish the over, Swann has an almighty heave but doesn't get close
Kulasekara aims at middle stump as Bell backs to leg, and the ball is tapped to cover for a single
a pinpoint yorker is dug out on the leg side, and they scramble a single
pushed to cover, another manic single
bouncer from Kulasekara, flat-batted to cover

a slower ball is lapped straight to Lakmal at short fine leg, and that is probably the end for England. It was a slower ball from Kulasekara, and Bell went right across to off to get himself in a good position, but there was no pace to work with and the connection was only good enough to send the ball down the fielder's throat. He accepted the gift with a smile, and Sri Lanka are very close to drawing level in the series
driven square, Swann charges out but Anderson is looking at the ball, not his partner, and he's sent back very late ... the throw is wide, however, and he's home
a searing yorker takes the inside edge and speeds down to fine leg
unplayable! Anderson must surely have been expecting the yorker, but there's not much he could do about this. Leg stump is pegged back, and England are nine down now
Dernbach backs to leg as Malinga approaches, and swishes aimlessly outside off. Beaten, it's fair to say.
again he's right away to leg before Malinga is even at the crease, weaving away from a bouncer this time. He's giving Malinga all three stumps to aim at
full, straight and hacked to cover. A classic No. 11's shot
Malinga aims full again, this time Dernbach drives to mid-off
pleading appeal as Swann is hit on the toe, but that was reversing down the leg side. Swann is in a bit of pain as he hobbles to the other end
Dernbach only knows one way to play: back to leg and swing. This time, the short ball takes the top edge of his swipe and flies over the keeper. First international runs
Dernbach jams down on the yorker but it rolls through to Sangakkara, they take a single and the shy misses the stumps
Lakmal aims for the yorker, but it slips out a full toss that is driven to long-on
length ball on off stump, Dernbach clears the left leg and smears it straight to long-off, that's the game!
